DPBL.title: Dental Problem Based Learning -- Human Clinical Dentistry IV
DPBL.description: Problem based learning approach to the delivery of dental health care. Didactic, preclinical and clinical principles of endodontics, geriatrics, oral diagnosis, oral pathology, oral radiology, oral surgery, orthodontics, pediatric dentistry, periodontics, prosthodontics and restorative dentistry will be presented with a direct relationship to a well-characterized human clinical case.

COH.title: Capstone Project
COH.description: Guided learning of the research process by the design and implementation of an approved project.

COH.title: Research and Biostatistics in Healthcare
COH.description: Introduction to research processes; emphasizes methods and designs frequently used to study health and health care delivery.

COH.title: Foundations and Strategies in Health Education
COH.description: Examines the impact of education in community oral health, identifying strategies to engage and empower the members of the community to achieve health and wellness.

COH.title: Health Assessment
COH.description: The importance of health assessment; identification of strategies to understand the needs and priorities of a healthy community.

COH.title: Practicum 2
COH.description: Incorporates a service learning approach involving a partnership between the student, community organization and designated faculty or research team members.

GDEN.title: Capstone Research Project for GDEN Students
GDEN.description: Production and defense of a research plan that demonstrates significant understanding of a topic in geriatric dentistry.

GDEN.title: Topics in Gerontology
GDEN.description: Gerontology topics for dentists including clinical assessment tools for aging patients, policy issues, myths, social supports, and consent and communication issues in the clinical setting. Open only to Master and Professional Dental students.

GDEN.title: Geriatric Dentistry Issues
GDEN.description: Common geriatric dentistry topics including epidemiology of oral diseases, common dental diseases, their management and prevention protocols for older adult patients. Open only to Master and Professional Dental students.

GDEN.title: OFPM Case Portfolio Preparation for Dental Residents
GDEN.description: Examination of clinical cases of geriatric patients with orofacial pain and oral lesions through online conferences in preparation, development and defense of portfolio of multiple cases.

GDEN.title: GDEN Case Portfolio Preparation for Dental Residents
GDEN.description: Examination of clinical cases of geriatric patients with complex medical conditions through online conferences in preparation, development and defense of portfolio of multiple cases.

OPER.title: Operative Dentistry and Biomaterials Literature Review
OPER.description: Weekly seminar devoted to review of the historic, classic, and current literature in advanced operative dentistry and dental biomaterials.

OPER.title: Operative Dentistry and Biomaterials Literature Review
OPER.description: Weekly seminar devoted to review of the historic, classic, and current literature in advanced operative dentistry and dental biomaterials.

OPER.title: Operative Implant Dentistry
OPER.description: Basic principles of implants applied to operative and adhesive dentistry. Open only to Advanced Operative and Adhesive Dentistry majors. Graded CR/NC.

OPER.title: Applied Adhesion Sciences
OPER.description: Advanced adhesive procedures for aesthetic dental rehabilitation. Open only to Advanced and Adhesive Dentistry majors. Graded CR/NC.

OPER.title: Research Methodology
OPER.description: Study of research methodologies for scientific investigation on dental biomaterials.

OPER.title: Treatment Planning in Operative Dentistry
OPER.description: Seminars led by students and invited guests to discuss, analyse    and propose a treatment sequence for esthetic challengeclinical    cases involving complex multidisciplinary treatment.

OPER.title: Treatment Planning in Operative Dentistry
OPER.description: Seminars led by students and invited guests to discuss, analyse    and propose a treatment sequence for esthetic challenge clinical   cases involving complex multidisciplinary treatment.

OPER.title: Clinic: Advanced Operative Dentistry
OPER.description: Advanced clinical and laboratorial treatment of patients in need   of complex multidisciplinary treatment, with specialemphasis on    esthetic and bonded restorations.

OPER.title: Clinic: Advanced Operative Dentistry
OPER.description: Advanced clinical and laboratorial treatment of patients in need of complex multidisciplinary treatment, with specialemphasis on esthetic and bonded restorations.

OPR.title: Bone Pathology and Oral and Maxillofacial Radiology
OPR.description: Focus on the interpretation of hard tissue imaging studies, including conventional dental imaging in the diagnosis along with the basics of medical radiographic modalities.

OPR.title: General and Systemic Human Pathology
OPR.description: Disease mechanisms and principles of the pathological entities associated with each organ system.

OPR.title: Clinical Cases in Oral Pathology and Radiology
OPR.description: E-portfolio of Oral Pathology or Radiology cases, demonstrating the ability to apply the knowledge to different cases and scenarios.

OFP.title: Neurogenic Based Oral and Facial Pains
OFP.description: Covers the prevalence, differential diagnosis, prevention and management  for the various neurogenic orofacial and headache disorders occurring in the oral regions.

OFP.title: Case Portfolio Preparation
OFP.description: Case portfolio preparation with weekly online  presentations and discussions of de-identified patient cases.

OFP.title: Case Portfolio Preparation
OFP.description: Case portfolio preparation with weekly online presentations and discussions of de-identified patient cases.

OFPM.title: Neurogenic Based Oral and Facial Pains for Dental Residents
OFPM.description: Seminars on the diagnostic and therapeutic procedures appropriate  for chronic neurogenic based pain disorders that occur in the  orofacial region.

OFPM.title: Headaches for Dental Residents
OFPM.description: Seminars on the diagnosis, prevention and management of (including pathophysiologic mechanisms) of episodic and chronic headache disorders.

OFPM.title: Neurosciences for Dental Residents
OFPM.description: Seminars on the neurophysiologic and neuroanatomic bases of  chronic orofacial pain disorders.

OFPM.title: Psychological and Psychometric Assessment for Dental Residents
OFPM.description: Seminars on various topics relating to biobehavioral diagnosis  and, where appropriate, psychological management of patients with  chronic illness in the orofacial region.

OFPM.title: Immunology and Immunosuppression for Dental Residents
OFPM.description: Seminar course on immunology and immunosuppression as it relates to diseases in the oral and maxillofacial region.

OFPM.title: Capstone Project for OFPOM Residents
OFPM.description: Residents complete their capstone research project in a topic in the area of their chosen focus/specialization.

OFPM.title: Capstone Project for OFPOM Residents
OFPM.description: Residents complete their capstone research project in a topic in the area of their chosen focus/specialization.

OFPM.title: Case Portfolio Preparation by Online OFPOM Residents
OFPM.description: Multiple elements including weekly online conferences, presentations and discussions of de-identified patient cases; learning need assignments; preparation and defense of case-based e-Portfolio.

OFPM.title: Case Portfolio Preparation by Online OFPOM Residents
OFPM.description: Multiple elements including weekly online conferences, presentations and discussions of de-identified patient cases; learning need assignments; preparation and defense of case-based e-Portfolio.

OFPM.title: Case Portfolio Preparation by Online OFPOM Residents
OFPM.description: Multiple elements including weekly online conferences, presentations and discussions of de-identified patient cases; learning need assignments; preparation and defense of case-based e-Portfolio.

OFPM.title: Case Portfolio Preparation by Online OFPOM Residents
OFPM.description: Multiple elements including weekly online conferences, presentations and discussions of de-identified patient cases; learning need assignments; preparation and defense of case-based e-Portfolio.

OFPM.title: Case Portfolio Preparation by Online OFPOM Residents
OFPM.description: Multiple elements including weekly online conferences, presentations and discussions of de-identified patient cases; learning need assignments; preparation and defense of case-based e-Portfolio.

OFPM.title: Capstone Presentation
OFPM.description: Capstone research project for residents on a topic in the area of their chosen focus/specialization.

DANC.title: Colloquium I: Joining the Creative Community
DANC.description: Introduction to a vibrant creative community. Students will explore university resources, engage with faculty, guest artists and staff, and establish goals for sustainability and growth.

DANC.title: Dance Technique I
DANC.description: Fundamental technique studies in a studio setting. Concentration on classical ballet, hip hop and its derivatives, partnering and contemporary techniques essential to the dancers' development. Placement audition required.

DANC.title: Repertory and Performance I
DANC.description: Study and guided practice of choreographic repertory. Emphasis in choreographic intention, stylistic approaches and performance technique.

DANC.title: Composition: Movement Invention and Syntax
DANC.description: Applying improvisational tools to the development of set choreography and/or the development of functional improvisational structures for spontaneous composition in performance.

DANC.title: Mindfulness for Dancers
DANC.description: An introduction to mindfulness and other practices supportive to the dancer explored through reading, viewing, lecture, discussion and cultural contextualization.

DANC.title: Dance and New Media
DANC.description: An introduction to various genres within Dance and New Media, including simple hands-on work with existing and emerging technologies used in creating and delivering media-dance works. No previous dance experience is required.

DANC.title: Contemporary Dance
DANC.description: An introduction to methods developed from modern and post-modern dance techniques, including the study of the rebellious, individualistic, and democratic nature of dance in the 20th and 21st centuries.

DANC.title: Contemporary Dance
DANC.description: Continued study in the fusion of modern, post-modern dance and classical ballet techniques encompassing the study of the democratic nature of dance and choreographic composition in the 20th and 21st centuries.

DANC.title: Ballet
DANC.description: An introduction to Classical Ballet technique with beginning-level barre and center work, focusing on correct body alignment and musicality. Development of a basic knowledge of ballet history and terminology.

DANC.title: Ballet
DANC.description: Continued study of Classical Ballet technique with intermediate-level barre and center work, focusing on developing greater clarity, coordination, musicality, and knowledge of ballet history and terminology.

DANC.title: Ballet
DANC.description: Intermediate/advanced study of Classical Ballet technique with emphasis on clarity, precision, musicality, movement quality, and artistic expression. Introduction of beats, tours, advanced adagio and allegro combinations, and optional pointe work.

DANC.title: Jazz Dance
DANC.description: An introduction to Jazz Dance technique, focusing on African and Latin based diaspora dances with European influences, improvisation, and strength/stretching series.

DANC.title: Jazz Dance
DANC.description: Advanced study of Jazz Dance technique, focusing on Broadway, commercial, and concert Jazz Dance, with a continued emphasis on improvisation, center work, and performance techniques.

DANC.title: Hip Hop Dance
DANC.description: An introduction to elements of Hip Hop Dance, including technique, movement, musical rhythm, tempo, and phrasing, as well as the historical context required to develop the skills needed to practice and perform this popular dance form.

DANC.title: Breaking
DANC.description: An introduction to elements of Hip Hop Dance, including technique, movement, musical rhythm, tempo, and phrasing, as well as the historical context required to develop the skills needed to practice and perform this popular dance form.

DANC.title: Hip Hop Dance
DANC.description: Continued study of Hip Hop Dance elements on an intermediate level, augmenting the historical context, technique, fluidity, and musicality required to execute the form with greater movement acuity.

DANC.title: Bollywood Dance
DANC.description: An introduction to basic and intermediate Bollywood Dance, including technique, movement, musical rhythm, phrases, and choreography. Inspired by the high energy music from Indian films, Bollywood is a fusion form that combines traditional Indian folk and classical dances with Hip Hop, Jazz, Latin, and Middle-eastern dance.

DANC.title: International Style Ballroom Dance
DANC.description: Introduction to International Standard, International Latin, and American Style ballroom dances. Designed to introduce students to the fundamentals of ballroom dance, emphasizing partner connection, communication, and creativity, with the practical application of dance within a social setting.

DANC.title: International Style Ballroom Dance
DANC.description: Continued study in International Standard, International Latin, and American Style ballroom dances. Designed for advanced knowledge in ballroom styles, emphasizing rhythmic sequences, partnering techniques, complex patterns, and performance quality.

DANC.title: Tap Dance
DANC.description: An introduction to basic Tap Dance technique, rhythms, syncopation, and musicality, developing into complex steps and elementary dances with progressive understanding of weight change, improvisation, and combinations of sound.

DANC.title: Colloquium II: Investing in the Collaboratory
DANC.description: Continued investment in the creative community, with a focus on best practices for sharing work, soliciting feedback and establishing healthy relationships with fellow creators.

DANC.title: Dance Technique II
DANC.description: Intermediate technique studies in a studio setting. Concentration on classical ballet, hip hop and its derivatives, partnering and contemporary techniques essential to the dancers' development.

DANC.title: Dance in Popular Culture
DANC.description: Examination of the role of dance in popular culture in a classroom setting. Studies of dance styles and their evolution in recreational and professional contexts through research, observation, and practice.

DANC.title: Introduction to Dance Media Composition
DANC.description: Effective navigation and utilization of digital technologies to create dance-based media compositions and online portfolios.

DANC.title: Repertory and Performance II
DANC.description: Continued studies and guided practice of choreographic repertory. Investigation of choreographic vocabulary, intention, stylistic approaches, and performance technique for group work.

DANC.title: Composition: Collaborative Creation
DANC.description: Continued integration of interdisciplinary design elements resulting in the more fully realized production and presentation of choreographic work.

DANC.title: Introduction to Dance as an Art Form
DANC.description: Gateway to the minor in dance.  An interdisciplinary overview of dance relating to the aesthetic and art in various subjects. Applications of the elements of dance studies, art criticism, and viewing productions to explore topic such as architecture, photography, poetry, technology, cinematic arts, sports, medicine, and more.

DANC.title: Hip Hop Don't Stop: Black Social Dance Culture and Media
DANC.description: Introduction to the history and practice of Urban Folk Dance including hip hop, freestyle, street dance and the relevant social dances of the 20th century.

DANC.title: Dance Science: Analysis of Dance Movement
DANC.description: A broad overview of the scientific principles of exercise physiology, functional anatomy, kinesiology, and bio-mechanics with applications to dance.

DANC.title: Dance Technique III
DANC.description: Advanced technique studies in a studio setting. Concentration on classical ballet, hip hop and its derivatives, partnering and contemporary techniques essential to the dancers' development.

DANC.title: Repertory and Performance III
DANC.description: Study and guided practice of new works and developing roles. Emphasis on the dancer as collaborator in the creative process.

DANC.title: Origins of Jazz Dance
DANC.description: Examining the role that vernacular dance and music play in the creation of Jazz Dance, taught in lecture format; practical studies in Jazz Dance, from recreational to professional settings.

DANC.title: International and Historical Perspectives on Dance
DANC.description: Exploration of dance as an art form in its artistic, political, and socio-cultural climate. Studies of the continuum of dance within its historical context.

DANC.title: Artist Collaborative
DANC.description: Development of an artistic work of two or more media, working with colleagues and or faculty in allied disciplines. Open only to Dance majors.

DANC.title: Advanced Composition
DANC.description: Explore a variety of compositional forms and methods to develop a personalized choreographic approach.

DANC.title: Pilates Mat Training
DANC.description: Mat exercises designed to promote healthy movement practices, develop strength, balance, flexibility and coordination.

DANC.title: Dancing on the Screen
DANC.description: The study of dance in movies, television, internet, mobile devices and new media. Examining dance on screen, influenced by storytelling, camera technology and editing.

DANC.title: Intermediate/Advanced Commercial Dance
DANC.description: Designed to build higher level skills in preparation for success in the commercial dance industry. Development of an intermediate/advanced technical skill set in preparation for auditions, on-screen performances and interactions with agents.

DANC.title: Dance Technique IV
DANC.description: Pre-professional technique studies in a studio setting with concentration on classical ballet, hip hop and its derivatives, and contemporary techniques essential to the dancers' development.

DANC.title: Repertory and Performance IV
DANC.description: Study and guided practice of significant roles in new and existing choreography. Emphasis on refinement of partnering, solo and group performance technique.

DANC.title: Dance Leadership
DANC.description: An examination of leadership in the dance world through concepts of capacity building, strategic planning and infrastructure to articulate a mission statement, understand models of entity structure, contracts, marketing, financial responsibilities, governance, engagement with community, grants and funding.

DANC.title: Improvisational Strategies in Movement and Materiality
DANC.description: Studio course exploring movement as a lens for the study and innovation of fashion and costume design.

DANC.title: Dance Performance
DANC.description: Preparation, rehearsal, and performance of experimental choreography in main stage repertory.

DANC.title: Fourth-Year Project
DANC.description: Development and presentation of senior project in performance, choreography, media, music, scholarship or entrepreneurial enterprise. Senior projects presented to faculty panel in open performance venue.

DANC.title: Directed Research
DANC.description: Individual research and readings.

EDCO.title: Ethical and Legal Issues in Counseling
EDCO.description: Examination of current legal, ethical, and other professional issues in the practice of counseling and psychotherapy.

EDCO.title: Theories in Counseling
EDCO.description: Theory, research, and practice of psychological counseling.        Includes laboratory experience.

EDCO.title: Internship
EDCO.description: Supervised practicum experience in a clinical setting.

EDCO.title: Internship
EDCO.description: Supervised practicum experience in a clinical setting.

EDUE.title: Identity and Diversity
EDUE.description: Explore the historical and contemporary foundations of hierarchies and relationships of power, sociocultural diversity of experiences and sociopolitical resistance within higher education.

EDUE.title: Research Methods and Applied Educational Ethnography
EDUE.description: Explore the use of quantitative, qualitative and mixed methods research to explore problems/opportunities of practice in higher education.

EDUE.title: Quantitative Method and Data Analysis for Education
EDUE.description: Develop skills to critically assess and apply quantitative research. Explore equitable approaches through systematic collection and analysis of data, utilizing standardized tools and statistical analysis.

EDUE.title: Advanced Theories in Mental Health Practice
EDUE.description: Apply advanced clinical, counseling and psychotherapy concepts into leadership practice. Emphasis on cultural humility, evidenced-based practice, marginalized communities and self-exploration.

EDUE.title: Consultation, Program Development and Evaluation
EDUE.description: Acquire skills to design, implement and assess evaluation studies and consult with other mental health organizations. Focus on cultural humility via program design and evaluation.

EDUE.title: Foundations in Learning
EDUE.description: Supports the development of critically conscious leaders who facilitate learning in urban contexts by understanding how culture, identity and power influence learners opportunities to learn.

EDUE.title: Power, Diversity and Equity
EDUE.description: Explores power, diversity and equity through the social, historical, and political lenses as these constructs shape and impact education (P-20) research, policy and professional practice.

EDUE.title: Advanced Clinical Topics
EDUE.description: Explore specialized clinical topics in mental health, emphasizing practical application and employee skill development in crisis intervention, trauma treatment, grant writing, budgeting and professional communication.

EDUE.title: Designing Educational Organizations for Equity
EDUE.description: Introduction to organizational theory and design with emphasis on building and leading organizations based on the principles of equity and social justice.

EDUE.title: Leading for Instructional Excellence and Equity
EDUE.description: Improves K-12 practitioners' instructional leadership capacity, addressing power and its impact on creating and perpetuating educational inequities for historically marginalized and minoritized children and adults.

EDUE.title: Research Methods 1
EDUE.description: Explores the historically complex relationship between education research, education (in)equity and personal practice, and will highlight the possibilities of research to foster justice in education through the examination of the utility of basic and applied quantitative, qualitative and mixed methods research.

EDUE.title: Research Methods 2
EDUE.description: Building on Research Methods 1, students learn to implement a research design by conducting pilot studies to answer quantitative and qualitative research questions.

EDUE.title: Dissertation in Practice
EDUE.description: Supports students to prepare a literature review, overview of methodology and other contextual writing for their dissertations in practice and prepare for the qualifying exam.

EDUE.title: Dissertation in Practice, Data Analysis
EDUE.description: Builds students' knowledge and skills for analyzing quantitative and qualitative data and reporting results and findings for their Dissertations in Practice.

EDUE.title: Dissertation in Practice, Data Analysis
EDUE.description: Builds students' knowledge and skills for analyzing quantitative and qualitative data and reporting results and findings for their Dissertations in Practice.

EDUE.title: Dissertation in Practice, Data Analysis
EDUE.description: Builds students knowledge and skills for analyzing quantitative and qualitative data and reporting results and findings for their Dissertations in Practice.

EDUE.title: Dissertation in Practice, Data Analysis
EDUE.description: Builds students knowledge and skills for analyzing quantitative and qualitative data and reporting results and findings for their Dissertations in Practice.

EDUE.title: Dissertation in Practice, Data Analysis
EDUE.description: Builds students knowledge and skills for analyzing quantitative and qualitative data and reporting results and findings for their Dissertations in Practice.

EDHP.title: Curriculum, Teaching, and Learning in Higher, Adult, and Professional Education
EDHP.description: Curriculum, teaching, and learning strategies for general, vocational, and professional education; planning for lifelong learning; theories, policies, and practices for higher, adult and professional education.

EDHP.title: Feminist Theory
EDHP.description: History of feminist theory and major perspectives of current feminist theory: liberal feminism, socialist/Marxist feminism, radical feminism, psychological feminism, spiritual feminism, and ecological feminism.

EDHP.title: The Community College
EDHP.description: Community college movement; history; aims; curriculum; types of administrative organization; teaching procedures; relation to lower and higher institutions; profiles of faculty and students; evaluation.

EDHP.title: Practicum in Higher, Adult and Professional Education
EDHP.description: Structured participation in supervised teaching or administrative activities. Assignments matched with student's goals, training, experience.

EDHP.title: Master's Seminar
EDHP.description: An examination and analysis of research and literature in the  student's area of focus.  Required for all master's candidates  candidates who do not enroll in the Master's Thesis (594abz).   Graded CR/NC.

EDHP.title: Master's Thesis
EDHP.description: Required for all master's candidates who do not enroll in the  Master's Seminar (593ab).  Credit on acceptance of thesis.  Graded  IP/CR/NC.

EDHP.title: Leadership and Management in Student Affairs
EDHP.description: Delivery of student services and programs in higher education, organizational behavior, management systems, administrative procedures, and alternative leadership styles.

EDPT.title: Learning and Individual Differences
EDPT.description: Theory and research in learning, development and individual differences, and social psychology related to education in instructional or training contexts.

EDUC.title: Education for Social Change
EDUC.description: Examines access to schooling and quality education across student difference indexed by race, class and gender.  Promotes understanding of U.S. public schooling for equitable outcomes.

EDUC.title: Educational Inquiry for Equity
EDUC.description: Introduction to educational inquiry for equity. Use educational research methods to learn more about educational theory and practice through on-site visits to schools and community-based organizations.

EDUC.title: The Counseling Process
EDUC.description: Theoretical foundations, models, values, and assumptions underlying psychological counseling; cross-cultural perspectives, ethical and legal considerations.

EDUC.title: Interrogating Systems of Inequity in Professional Practice
EDUC.description: Framing the graduate experience for master's students. Examining self and field of professional practice in the context of achieving equity.

EDUC.title: Introduction to Counseling
EDUC.description: The role of the school counselor. An overview of key elements in increasing access to and equity for primary and secondary education for all students.

EDUC.title: Theories of Marriage, and Family Therapy
EDUC.description: Major psychotherapeutic orientations relating to family systems, marital relationships, and communications theory applied to the family unit.

EDUC.title: Career and College Readiness Counseling
EDUC.description: Theoretical foundations of individual and systemic characteristics that impact college and career choices. Consideration of economic, political, social and policy issues.

EDUC.title: Student Disability Issues in Higher Education
EDUC.description: History of the disability movement; current research on the  success of students with disabilities in higher education; legal  and management issues.

EDUC.title: School Leadership: Theory and Practice
EDUC.description: Theories and principles of leadership and the application of principles to solve authentic problems in elementary and secondary schools.

EDUC.title: Collaboration, Consultation and Assessment in Counseling
EDUC.description: Understand educational and psychological instruments, psychometric concepts and rationale for the use of instruments in the school counseling setting.

EDUC.title: Substance Abuse Counseling
EDUC.description: Focus on theoretical models of substance abuse counseling and understanding the role of assessment, treatment, medical and psychological complications, family and recovery.

EDUC.title: Family Counseling
EDUC.description: Master family counseling approaches, systemic models of K-12 family functioning and therapeutic interventions to work with families of diverse backgrounds.

EDUC.title: Psychological Assessment
EDUC.description: Utilizing a wide range of clinical assessment tools with cultural sensitivity to achieve a comprehensive patient profile to guide the therapeutic process.

EDUC.title: Career Development: Theory and Process
EDUC.description: Theories and process of career development; principles of career and leisure planning and counseling applicable throughout life.

EDUC.title: Psychopharmacology and the Effects of Substance Abuse
EDUC.description: Focus on the effects of psychotropic medication, alcohol, and other substances on behavior. The professional and ethical issues for marriage and family therapists.

EDUC.title: Research Methods and Data Analysis
EDUC.description: Various research designs and their appropriateness for addressing different research questions. Threats to validity and other challenges in research. Basic statistical methods and their use. Recommended preparation: beginning statistics course.

EDUC.title: Master's Studio B
EDUC.description: Students implement the capstone project and submit a portfolio that integrates program coursework.

EDUC.title: Designing Instruction Across the Lifespan
EDUC.description: Fundamentals of human physical, motor, mental, social, and emotional development, spanning the prenatal period through late adulthood.

EDUC.title: Directed Research
EDUC.description: Research leading to the master's degree.  Maximum units which  may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department.   Graded CR/NC.

EDUC.title: Inclusive and Accessible Instructional Design
EDUC.description: Appraises practices that maintain power; creates strategies to empower individuals and marginalized groups by intervening to achieve equitable outcomes in education, professions and communities.

EDUC.title: Athletic Administration
EDUC.description: Analysis and discussion of critical issues in intercollegiate  athletics. Student-athlete academic and social accountability;  challenges of NCAA policies; commercialization, marketing, and  fundraising in college athletics.

EDUC.title: Application of Human Development Theory in School Counseling
EDUC.description: A theoretical perspective of human development across the lifespan. Issues and challenges faced by school counselors.

EDUC.title: Understanding Research That Informs Leadership
EDUC.description: Understanding, interpreting, and applying education research. Open only to doctoral students.

EDUC.title: Education Performance Problems: Role of Learning
EDUC.description: Contemporary perspectives on learning and motivation. Strategies and tools for identifying, diagnosing, and solving learning and motivational challenges and opportunities.

EDUC.title: Consulting Practicum Context Analysis
EDUC.description: Preparation, design and analysis of an education-related problem.

EDUC.title: Organizations and Policy: Current Issues
EDUC.description: Study of contemporary issues in educational organizations, policy  and change in K-12 and higher education with an explicit focus on  the improvement of urban education.  Open to students admitted to  the Ph.D. only.

EDUC.title: Couples Counseling
EDUC.description: Examination of relational development and change, strategies for  intervention with couples, and selected issues in couples  relational functioning.

EDUC.title: Psychotherapy with Children and Adolescents
EDUC.description: Training in unique diagnostic considerations in working with children and adolescents. Exposure to empirically supported treatment modalities for children and adolescents.

EDUC.title: Group Counseling: Theory and Process
EDUC.description: Theory, research, and practice of group counseling. Includes laboratory experience.

EDUC.title: Multicultural Counseling: Research and Practice
EDUC.description: An examination of the cultural, socioeconomic, and language factors that impact historically marginalized populations; alternative multicultural counseling approaches.

EDUC.title: Practicum II
EDUC.description: Supervised practicum experience in a clinical setting.

EDUC.title: Marriage and Family Therapy Capstone:  Leadership Project
EDUC.description: Culminating academic, professional and reflective experience for MFT candidates in their final year.  Students will identify and address issues of professional and clinical practice.

EDUC.title: Qualitative Methods 1
EDUC.description: Introduces qualitative methodologies, qualitative data collection and analysis techniques, support in drafting research proposals, and paradigms on how to critically think about inquiry.

EDUC.title: Qualitative Methods 2
EDUC.description: Interactive seminar that explores the theoretical underpinnings and practicalities of interviews, portraiture, focus groups, life histories, and cultural biographies.

EDUC.title: Racism and Anti-Blackness in Education
EDUC.description: A holistic understanding of the historical underpinnings, persistent pathways and contemporary pillars of racism and white supremacy in education.

EDUC.title: Proseminar in Education
EDUC.description: Introduction to faculty and their research; provides professional development on a variety of topics.

EDUC.title: Capstone Seminar
EDUC.description: Synthesize institutional, public and non-public sources of data to write and orally present an enrollment management plan for both campus and external stakeholders.

EDUC.title: Evaluating and Assessing Educational System Outcomes
EDUC.description: Evaluating impact. Examination of key assessment theories; planning and implementation of learning and program effectiveness.

EDUC.title: Implementing Policy in Educational Systems
EDUC.description: Effective policy-making. Human and financial resources to support implementation. Targeting resources to support implementation to attain policy goals. Prerequisite: EDUC 726. Open only to doctoral students.

EDUC.title: Assessing Policy Impact in Educational Settings
EDUC.description: Theory and practice of educational policy evaluation. Limits of rationality and the political forces that shape policy. Preparation of an evaluation design. Prerequisite: EDUC 727. Open only to doctoral students.

EDUC.title: Analyzing Data and Identifying Solutions
EDUC.description: Designed to help students interpret study data and construct evidence-based solutions for real-time organizational problems of practice.

EDUC.title: Dissertation in Practice
EDUC.description: Credit on acceptance of Dissertation in Practice.

EDUC.title: Dissertation in Practice
EDUC.description: Credit on acceptance of Dissertation in Practice.

EDUC.title: Research
EDUC.description: Research leading to the doctorate.  Maximum units which may be  applied to the degree to be determined by the department.  Graded  CR/NC.

EDUC.title: Proposal for Doctoral Dissertation
EDUC.description: Preparation on initial dissertation proposal. Graded CR/NC.

EDUC.title: Doctoral Dissertation
EDUC.description: Credit on acceptance of dissertation.  Graded IP/CR/NC.

EDUC.title: Doctoral Dissertation
EDUC.description: Credit on acceptance of dissertation.  Graded IP/CR/NC.

AME.title: Statics
AME.description: Analysis of forces acting on particles and rigid bodies in static equilibrium; equivalent systems of forces; friction; centroids and moments of inertia; introduction to energy methods.

AME.title: Mechanics of Materials and Structures
AME.description: Stress, strain and deflection of mechanical elements due to tension, shear, bending, or torsion; combined loads; plates, shells, statically indeterminate structures; strength-based design, trusses.

AME.title: Computational Methods in Engineering
AME.description: Common tools for Aerospace and Mechanical engineers: vectors, matrices, fundamentals of python, data manipulation and analysis, statistics, data presentation, optimization, large data sets.

AME.title: Basic Flight Mechanics
AME.description: Performance of flight vehicles; maximum speed, rate-of-climb, range, and endurance; basic stability and control, weight, and balance; computer exercises.

AME.title: Advanced Composites Design Project
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  lower division students or those with little prior project  experience.  Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Dynamics
AME.description: Reference frames and coordinate systems; relationships between forces, moments, power, linear/angular momentum, and energy for particles and rigid bodies; particle and rigid body systems.

AME.title: Systems
AME.description: Mathematical modeling of constrained mechanical systems at different levels of complexity, design-oriented approach to dynamic systems, transfer function formulation, state-space models and block diagram representation.

AME.title: Systems
AME.description: Modeling of combined dynamic systems at different levels of complexity; time domain open-loop system analysis; system stability; approximation with lower-order systems; engineering applications.

AME.title: Computer-Aided Engineering
AME.description: Introduction to the finite element method; practical application of computer analysis tools for structural analysis and design.

AME.title: Dynamics of Fluids
AME.description: Fluid statics; conservation of mass, momentum, and energy in integral and differential form; applications. Laminar and turbulent pipe flow; compressible flow; potential flow over bodies.

AME.title: Engineering Thermodynamics I
AME.description: Laws of thermodynamics applied to actual and perfect gases and vapors; energy concepts, processes, and applications; energy, entropy, and exergy analysis; power and refrigeration systems

AME.title: Mechoptronics Laboratory
AME.description: Coordinated laboratory and lecture sequence on aeromechanical instrumentation, test and measurement, integration of mechanical, optical and electronic components and technical communication.

AME.title: Functional Approach to Computational Methods
AME.description: Introduction to computational methods in engineering: learning to develop and implement numerical algorithms for solving a range of mathematics, physics, and engineering problems. Suitable for undergraduate students in aerospace, bio, civil and mechanical engineering.

AME.title: Computer-Aided Design of Mechanical Systems
AME.description: Design of mechanical systems using advanced graphics techniques; computer-aided drafting, design optimization, elements of computer graphics, solids modeling; introduction to computer-aided manufacturing.

AME.title: Senior Design Project
AME.description: Modelling, analysis, integration, layout and performance analysis of a mechanical system to meet the specified design requirements.

AME.title: Turbine Design and Analysis
AME.description: Physics of turbine operation; design and analysis for the development of turbine hardware for propulsion and power generation. Recommended Preparation: Familiarity with Matlab.

AME.title: Mechanics and Transport in Medicine and Biology
AME.description: Introduction to mechanics of living organs; analysis of fluid and solid forces acting on biological systems; introductory hemodynamics and bio-transport phenomena.

AME.title: Engineering Vibrations I
AME.description: Theory of free and forced vibrations with and without damping; systems of single and multiple degrees of freedom; iteration; methods; vibration isolation; instrumentation.

AME.title: Heat Transfer
AME.description: General principles underlying heat transfer by conduction, convection, and radiation; steady and transient conditions; heat exchangers.

AME.title: Automotive and Flight Propulsion
AME.description: Analysis of combustion engines: reciprocating-piston, gas turbines, rockets. Tradeoffs compared to non-combustion sources. Ideal and non-ideal cycle analysis and performance evaluation; pollutant formation and remediation.

AME.title: Senior Projects Laboratory
AME.description: Team engineering design project to model, construct and test a physical principle or system. Complete industrial research project including proposal, design review, presentation, technical report.

AME.title: Senior Projects Laboratory
AME.description: Individual engineering projects designed and constructed to modeland test a physical principle or system.

AME.title: Control Systems Laboratory
AME.description: Vibration measurement and analysis; simulation, design, and experimental verification of mechanical control systems; system identification; implementation of controllers; performance evaluation via experimentation and stimulation.

AME.title: Linear Control Systems I
AME.description: Transform methods, block diagrams; transfer functions; stability; root-locus and frequency domain analysis and design; application to flight control, state space and multiloop systems.

AME.title: Engineering Dynamics
AME.description: Principles of dynamics applied to mechanical and aerospace        problems. Introduction to gyroscopic motion and rigid body         dynamics.

AME.title: Bio-inspired Robotics
AME.description: Robotics terminology; limitations of conventional robots; converting biologically inspired concepts into implementable engineering designs; potential applications.

AME.title: Aircraft Design
AME.description: Aircraft design and analysis, design requirements and specifications; integration of structure, propulsion, control system, and aerodynamic configuration; performance analysis and prediction.

AME.title: Mechanics of Composite Materials for Modern Structures
AME.description: Current and potential applications of composite materials including manufacturing methods; determining mechanical properties; failure analysis; and design, inspection, and repair considerations.

AME.title: Directed Research
AME.description: Individual research and readings. Not available for graduate credit.

AME.title: Advanced Composites Design Project
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  students with prior project experience.  Upper division standing.   Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Advanced Robotic Combat 1.0
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  students with prior project experience.  Upper division standing.   Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Advanced Spacecraft Propulsion and Energy Laboratoy
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  students with prior project experience.  Upper division standing.   Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Aerodesign Project
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  students with prior project experience.  Upper division standing.   Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Formula SAE Electric Project
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  students with prior project experience.  Upper division standing.   Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Formula SAE Project
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  students with prior project experience.  Upper division standing.   Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Human Powered Vehicle Project
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  students with prior project experience.  Upper division standing.   Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Solar Car Project
AME.description: Analysis, design, fabrication, and evaluation of devices intended  for entry in local and national design competitions.  Intended for  students with prior project experience.  Upper division standing.   Graded CR/NC.

AME.title: Innovative Conceptual Design for New Product Development
AME.description: A logic-based framework for conceptual design, including systematic concept generation and improvement, in innovative product developments.

AME.title: Advanced Mechanical Design
AME.description: Specific problems and methods of analysis in mechanical systems design.

AME.title: Mechatronics Systems Engineering
AME.description: Use of mechanical, electrical and computer engineering, math and computer science to design of high performance and sophisticated products and processes and systems involving mechatronics.

AME.title: Machine Learning and Computational Physics
AME.description: Machine learning applications in computational physics and engineering; relationships between computational physics and ML algorithms; hybrid physics-informed ML prediction with tools for uncertainty quantification.

AME.title: Applied Elasticity
AME.description: Cartesian tensors; kinematics of deformation, balance laws, and constitutive equations; variational principles; finite elasticity; plates and cylindrical shells; viscoelasticity; analytical and numerical solutions for elasticity.

AME.title: Compressible Gas Dynamics
AME.description: Compressible flow equations; Rayleigh/Fanno flows; shock/expansion waves and interactions; potential flow, small disturbance theory and similarity; hypersonics; viscosity, high-temperature and radiation effects.

AME.title: Fundamentals and Applications of Combustion
AME.description: Advanced topics in combustion including analytical methods, stretch effects, stability, ignition and extinction of flames, plasma-assisted combustion, turbulence effects, detonations, and micropower generation.

AME.title: Advanced Engineering Dynamics
AME.description: Principle of virtual work, constraints, Lagrange's equations,  Gibbs-Appell equations, Gauss's principle, theory of rotations,  dynamics of rigid bodies, Hamiltonian mechanics, control and  mechanics.

AME.title: Partial Differential Equations for Engineering Applications
AME.description: Solving linear heat, wave, Laplace and Poisson equations, separation of variables and Fourier series, special functions, Fourier and Laplace transforms, characteristics, Greens functions, similarity solutions.

AME.title: Aircraft Structures Analysis
AME.description: Stress Analysis. Linear Elasticity. Thin Plates. Finite Element Methods. Structural stability. Vibration of Continuous Systems. Emphasis on aerospace and aeronautical applications

AME.title: Flight Vehicle Stability and Control
AME.description: Modeling, simulation, control and estimation of air vehicles, including the development of custom models and simulations for student-developed aircraft; extensions to non-air vehicles.

AME.title: Computer Control of Mechanical Systems
AME.description: Computer control as applied to machine tools, mechanical          manipulators, and other mechanical machinery; discrete time        controller design; microprocessor implementation of motion and     force control servos.

AME.title: Foundations for Manufacturing Automation
AME.description: An overview of the building blocks that underlie automation; mechanics-based models for designing automated systems; decision-making tools and methods for supporting manufacturing automation.

AME.title: Systems Architecting
AME.description: Introduction to systems architecture in aerospace, electrical,     computer, and manufacturing systems emphasizing the conceptual and acceptance phases and using heuristics.

AME.title: Seminar in Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering
AME.description: Recent developments and research in aerospace and mechanical engineering and related fields. Oral and written reports.

AME.title: Nonlinear Control Systems
AME.description: Phase plane, describing function, applications to mechanical and aerospace systems. Lyapunov stability theory. Popov theorem. Circle criterion. Lyapunov redesign. Sliding mode control. Backstepping. Passivity.

AME.title: Additive Manufacturing Technologies
AME.description: Overview and working principles of commonly used additive manufacturing processes; process models; process and material selection; cost estimation methods; current applications and future directions.

AME.title: Fatigue and Fracture
AME.description: Behavior of materials under cyclic and static fatigue; plastic instability; life-time predictions; brittle and ductile fracture; crack propagation and plastic blunting.

AME.title: Design and Advanced Manufacturing of Machine Components
AME.description: Modern CAE design for automotive and aerospace machine components; characterization methods, design tools and manufacturing techniques. Intended for students with prior CAE experience.

AME.title: Survey of Energy and Power for a Sustainable Future
AME.description: Power production includes conventional fossil fuels, synthetic fuels, hydroelectric, solar, wind, geothermal, biomass and nuclear. The environmental consequences of various energy sources are discussed.

AME.title: Aerospace Structures II
AME.description: Analysis of repairs in aircraft/launch vehicles. Flexible dynamics for spacecraft, random vibration, deployable spacecraft components, certification of thermal protection systems. Practical finite element analysis.

AME.title: Materials Selection
AME.description: Materials selection in relationship to design and fabrication, economic considerations, methodology of selection, performance parameters; case studies.

AME.title: Directed Research
AME.description: Research leading to the Master's Degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

AME.description: Credit on acceptance of Thesis.

CHE.title: Introduction to Chemical Engineering
CHE.description: Problem-solving techniques in chemical engineering, including an introduction to engineering problem analysis, mass balances, and energy balances.

CHE.title: Introduction to Separation Processes
CHE.description: Introduction to the design of chemical separation processes based on the principles of phase equilibrium, material balance and energy balance.

CHE.title: Introduction to Biomaterials and Tissue Engineering
CHE.description: Study of stem cells, biomaterials, and microfabrication techniques used to engineer human tissues. Labs for muscle tissue engineering, microscopy, and fabrication of cell culture substrates.

CHE.title: Chemical Reactor Design
CHE.description: Problem-solving techniques in Chemical Reactor Design, including the description of chemical kinetics and rates, and analysis of mass balances, and energy balances.

CHE.title: Chemical Engineering Laboratory
CHE.description: Conduct experiments and analyze data to generate results used to solve chemical engineering problems. Communicate results, data, and solutions in written reports and oral presentations.

CHE.title: Chemical Engineering Laboratory
CHE.description: Conduct experiments and analyze data to generate results used to solve chemical engineering problems. Communicate results, data, and solutions in written reports and oral presentations.

CHE.title: Heat and Mass Transfer in Chemical Engineering Processes
CHE.description: Differential and macroscopic equations of heat transfer; molecular and continuum approaches to diffusion and convection in fluids; simultaneous heat, mass and momentum transfer.

CHE.title: Sustainable Materials
CHE.description: Environmental impact and energy use in the production of natural materials, synthetic materials, biodegradable materials, and composites made of natural and synthetic materials

CHE.title: Chemical Process and Plant Design
CHE.description: Design and evaluate a chemical process/plant based on safety, economics, sustainability and engineering viability through the application of unit operations, thermodynamics, kinetics and separations.

CHE.title: Design of Environmentally Benign Process Plants
CHE.description: Chemical Process Plants interact with the environment as an integrated system. This course discusses design procedures to minimize unwanted effluents to air, water and solid wastes.

CHE.title: Directed Research
CHE.description: Individual research and readings. Not available for graduate credit.

CHE.title: Mathematical Methods for Deep Learning
CHE.description: Understanding deep learning: for students in engineering, physical  and life sciences and computer science with mathematical  background.

CHE.title: Thermodynamics for Chemical Engineers
CHE.description: Elements of classical and statistical thermodynamics. Molecular theory and property estimation, emphasis on multi-component multi-phase fluid systems. Advanced applications, including highly non-ideal solutions, polymers, electrolytes.

CHE.title: Seminars in Chemical Engineering
CHE.description: Seminars to cover recent developments in the field of chemical engineering given by invited speakers.

CHE.title: Advanced Separations for Energy and Environmental Applicatio
CHE.description: Experimental techniques for separation and bioseparation processes and theoretical and computational techniques for modeling them. Energy and environmental applications.

CHE.title: Directed Research
CHE.description: Research leading to the Master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

CHE.description: Credit on acceptance of Thesis. Graded CR/NC.

BME.title: Introduction to Biomedical Engineering
BME.description: Historical development and survey of major areas comprising biomedical engineering: theoretical neurobiology and systems physiology, biomedical instrumentation, artificial organ and prosthetic devices, biomedical computer applications.

BME.title: Biomedical Engineering Practice
BME.description: Examination of the technical and practical challenges involved in  the development of medical devices, including neural implants, in  industry and the clinical setting.  Recommended preparation: BME  101.

BME.title: Biomedical Computer Simulation Methods
BME.description: Computational methods for simulation of circulatory, respiratory, pharmacokinetic, and neural models. Quadrature, differential equations, systems of linear equations, simulation languages, experimental statistics.

BME.title: Computer-Aided Design for Bio-Mechanical Systems
BME.description: Concepts of computer-aided design in 2-dimensions and 3-dimensions. Creating advanced parts using extrusions, surfaces, and equation driven sketches. Forming assemblies and sub-assemblies, for motion analysis

BME.title: Physiological Systems
BME.description: A thorough bioengineering treatment of the physiological properties of various mammalian organ systems: e.g., cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, and musculoskeletal.

BME.title: Introduction to Biomaterials and Tissue Engineering
BME.description: Study of stem cells, biomaterials, and microfabrication techniques used to engineer human tissues. Labs for muscle tissue engineering, microscopy, and fabrication of cell culture substrates.

BME.title: Fundamentals of Craniofacial and Dental Technology
BME.description: Biomedical engineering and technology applied to oral health professions. Dental biomaterials, CAD-CAM, digital dental technology and tissue engineering applications to craniofacial diseases, disorders, and enhancements. Recommended preparation: junior standing.

BME.title: Regulation of Medical Products
BME.description: An introduction to the process of medical product development with emphasis on the regulations that govern the design, fabrication and maintenance of medical products.

BME.title: Mechanics and Transport in Medicine and Biology
BME.description: Introduction to mechanics of living organs; analysis of fluid and solid forces acting on biological systems; introductory hemodynamics and bio-transport phenomena.

BME.title: Senior Design Project
BME.description: Senior engineering design project; identify unmet needs in healthcare and/or wellness monitoring; propose, design, fabricate, and test a prototype solution to the unmet need.

BME.title: Introduction to Biosensors and Diagnostics Devices
BME.description: Introduction to biosensor technology, including classification and bio-recognition elements, and the integration of engineering and biology for the design of point-of-care biosensors.

BME.title: Introduction to Nanomedicine and Drug Delivery
BME.description: Drug delivery and use of nanoengineered materials, including cutting-edge nanoparticle-based therapy, imaging, and tissue engineering. Nanoparticle synthesis and characterization methods are introduced through labs.

BME.title: Directed Research
BME.description: Individual research and readings. Not available for graduate credit.

BME.title: Introduction to Deep Learning with Biomedical Applications
BME.description: Current trends and developments in the field of biomedical        engineering.

BME.title: Advanced Topics in Biomedical Systems
BME.description: Advanced topics in selected biomedical systems: cardiopulmonary, neuromuscular, renal and endocrine. Duplicates credit in BME 503ab.

BME.title: Laboratory Projects in Biomedical Engineering
BME.description: Integration of biomedical science, engineering principles and state-of-the-art technology for the study of selected physiological systems in the laboratory setting. Laboratory.

BME.title: Bioengineering of Disease and Cell Therapeutics
BME.description: Introduction to micro-/nano-technologies, microscopy, single-cell techniques, materials, surface chemistry, pathology, cancer, immunology, cell therapy and grant writing in biomedical research.

BME.title: Signal and Systems Analysis
BME.description: Classification; representation; statistical analysis; orthogonal expansions; least-squares estimation; harmonic analysis; Fourier, Laplace and Z transforms; the linear system; filtering; modeling and simulation; linear control theory.

BME.title: Physiological Signals and Data Analytics
BME.description: Application of linear time- and frequency-domain techniques, adaptive filtering, nonlinear dynamics and machine learning approaches to the analysis of  physiological signals.

BME.title: Advanced Biomedical Imaging
BME.description: Advanced scientific and engineering principles of biomedical imaging including magnetic resonance, X-ray computed tomography, ultrasound and single photon and positron emission tomography.

BME.title: Medical Diagnostics, Therapeutics and            Informatics Applications
BME.description: Picture archive communication system (PACS) design and implementation; clinical PACS-based imaging informatics; telemedicine/teleradiology; image content indexing, image data mining; grid computing in large-scale imaging informatics; image-assisted diagnosis, surgery and therapy.

BME.title: Introduction to Systems Biology
BME.description: Computational methods for simulation and analysis of metabolic networks, cellular signaling pathways, and gene regulatory networks. Biochemical kinetics, differential equations, stability analysis, sensitivity analysis.

BME.title: Seminar in Bioengineering
BME.description: Graded CR/NC.

BME.title: Health Product Development
BME.description: Conception and design of health-related, technological products; regulated aspects of medical products; risk analysis and design controls; engineering tools commonly used in product development.

BME.title: Computational Neural Engineering
BME.description: Introduction to computational modeling methods fundamental to neural engineering, with applications in brain-machine interfaces, neural prostheses, neuromodulation and neural system modeling.

BME.title: Directed Research
BME.description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

BME.description: Credit on acceptance of thesis. Graded IP/CR/NC
